title.label: Cumbersome game mechanics give too little reward for too much effort

content.label:
I have gotten to the second scene of the Azriel Arc and completed the first scene of the Delta-6 Arc.  And I am bored. I have not found a reason to care about either of the POV characters.  Itâ€™s obvious that someone cared a whole lot more about ensuring that armed combat was as true to life as possible than they did about user experience. The result is that everything gunfight is a slogfest that demands attention and adds difficulty without giving a payoff in terms of plot advancement. I do not want to spend 5-10 minutes reloading a gun, and waiting for the right moment to fire just so that I can get to the next locked-room puzzle. 

Normally I would wait until I have played through at least once before reviewing, but I just canâ€™t see myself picking it back up again.

title.label: A Big Bang for your buck

content.label: This game has everything an adventure gamer could want. Dystopian game theme. Great puzzles. Awesome voiceovers that lend to the concept of the game. Everything fits in, the music, screen movements, and backgrounds and the way it play. If this game came out in the 90â€™s, it would have cost $60. This is a steal for al the game play and great storyline. Played and auto saved perfectly on my iPhone 6s. Kudos to the developer.

title.label: Meh, itâ€™s a decent adventure title

content.label: I love the world building here and just about all the scenes on barracus were fun, but the scenes in sector 7 (I think thatâ€™s what it was called) got old after a while. I get you are trying to make the user feel trapped like the character by making us walk through multiple doors, but sometimes it just felt downright tedious. I also think the game could have used a bit more humor and the ending was ok-ish â€”just felt kind of flat. I would play a sequel though. There were definitely some amazing things about the title. Blade runner ish and even some cowboy beebop flavor too, it just feels like itâ€™s missing something.
I really loved this game. Technobabylon is even better than this if this point and click game style is to your liking, in my opinion of course!! But Gemini Rue is well worth your time and money!
A rare and unexpected gem of an adventure game, I hope the developers continue to provide us with quality games
Not what I expected. Bought it based off reviews comparing it to Facility47 but this game is nothing like it.
This game is absolutely perfect, especially in terms of the story. It becomes more and more interesting as one goes.
If youâ€™re into old school point and click adventure games, then this game is pure gaming bliss. Great characters and deep, rich storytelling, all of which is steeped in a rich atmosphere.
This game was extremely linear and repetitive. Got bored with it about halfway through and just wanted it to be over. Just a really amateurishly put together game overall.
A bleak environment, curmudgeon detective, gun fights, clues 2 B discovered and deciphered; with a film-noir feel.  If oneâ€™s a fan of point-and-click interactives, add this to your collection.

I love Wadjet Eye Games, especially the Blackwell series. This is another high-quality title, but I just couldnâ€™t finish it. Interacting with the world is needlessly tedious... why do I have to use my eyes on the scanner every single time I open a door? The action scenes tried to be innovative, but to me they feel out of place in an adventure game. And the story moves slowly and doesnâ€™t keep me in suspense. I can see why other people would like this game, but itâ€™s not for me. Iâ€™d recommend playing Blackwell first.

title.label: One of the Best Adventures Out There. Period.

content.label:
The second you boot up the game and see the main menu, you know this is going to be good. The art and sound combine to create a dreariness that is simply amazing on a mobile platform. The mechanics are smooth and uncomplicated, the puzzles are tough yet not impossible without a walkthrough, and the story is incredible. 

I know I'm late to the game on this one, but if you get the chance, this game is not one to miss. This is an experience you need to have.

title.label: Disappointing compared to other Wadjet Eye games

content.label: I found this to be disappointing compared to the Blackwell series and Shardlight. Visually less interesting and too much gun play required. Not a true point and click adventure.  Character illustrations used in dialogue scenes leave a lot to be desired. Deleted without finishing the game.
This game makes no sense to me, worst graphic, no one would love this game, i guess this 5 stars are not real , not worth buying.
Engaging story

So I love the graphics and attention to detail in the locations. The voices can be a bit strange though and what removes a star is that there are small black bars on the edges of the screen when I play the game on my iPhone 6 Plus just as a heads-up. I like the game so far, the setting and characters appear interesting. I'm not very far into the game but although I've had issues knowing what to do at first, it's a neat game worth a shot. The developer worked hard on this game and it shows. It could just use minor improvements in a future update to get rid of the black bars (optimize for larger phones), and fix any bugs it may have.

Anyone who grew up adoring 90's adventure games should do themselves a favor and play Gemini Rue. The story, puzzles, and art were all phenomenally well crafted, and I couldn't put it down until beating the thing in its entirety. Just sad it's over...

This game is a steal for the quality of product you are given for what is basically nothing (in the gaming world).  Great characters, setting and the storyline is top notch. This is a game that is fun to play and entirely satisfying. Old school style done perfectly. Don't miss this one.
Awful to look at!! Wish I hadn't bought it.

title.label: Blade Runner meets I Have No Mouth And I Must Scream

content.label:
Pros:
-Amazing, engrossing story.
-Logical puzzles offer some challenge, but med difficulty keeps the action going.
-Top notch voice acting.
-Amazing art direction, an entire world is created even with limited locations.
-Gun battles expand what is expected of an action game. The ability to die ups the stakes.
-The ability to tap the screen to see active objects saves you from the old Action game trope of trying to pick up everything.

Cons:
-Having to open doors repeatedly with a keycard or optical scan became tiresome. We get it. Make it automatic after the first instance.

-Hyper linear. For a story with many potential twists and turns, it was a little disappointing not to find multiple endings. Dialogue would hint at different possible outcomes without delivering. 

-Occasionally when another character is accompanying you they can trap you in a corner and you can't get out. Save your progress often so this doesn't happen.

Overall:
Amazing game that should be the beginning of a franchise. Play it. Great for Adventure Game addicts and newbies alike.

I really had no idea what to expect, I bought the game based on it supposedly being a good sci-fi adventure. Well, thank you for the recommendation, it was just that! What an unexpected surprise, something that actually fit the reviews and suggestions!
Clearly, I personally loved the game, but if you're not sure whether or not to get it, here's a brief description... It starts off with no explanation of anything, which is great because that's the whole point of the game, figuring out the story as it goes along. It was like playing a movie that you are watching at the same time. But just so you know, it's a pixelated game, I guess it was an older game converted to iOS. But I personally like this look... just realistic enough without looking weird. And the motions usually take more than one action to do tasks, which can occasionally get tedious when you're just opening doors, but that's really not an issue when that is how you problem-solve situations and literally figure the game out.
Overall, really cool game with a great story. And a nice touch hearing Giancarlo Esposito do one of the voice-overs! ðŸ˜„
Update: Giancarlo is not credited for the game... But it sure sounds like him!
If you are a fan of the point-and-click adventures from the 90's and early 00's, this game is for you. A real 'Full Throttle' experience. You won't regret the purchase!

title.label: One of the best adventure games ever penned.

content.label: This game is a work of literary brilliance. It digs deep into the what, when, and how it is to be human. As brilliant as Blade Runner, but playable. What online gaming fiction should be. A must play? A must play... And read.

What a treat! The best adventure game I've played in years, richly detailed, dark, engrossing atmosphere, memorable characters, a plot worthy of great classic film noir, with a clever twist near the end. I finished the game a week ago, and the story is still haunting my thoughts.

I guess I never played PC games, but am now discovering them on the IPAD.  A thoroughly enjoyable game, with a rich storyline and believable characters.  Puzzles were fun and just enough, but not too much, fighting.  Highly recommended!
Its impossible to look at, its so pixalated.  Absolutely stupid.

If you like detective novels, you will love this game. If you don't, you will still love this game! It's not perfect, there can be some repetitive tapping, and gunfights aren't ideal, but you become so engrossed in the story that you don't even care.

title.label: One of the best video games I've played, hands down.

content.label: Excellent story and game mechanics.

One of the best adventure games I have ever played. There were times that I was stuck and would put away my phone and when I come back I would figure out what to do. I thought it wasn't that difficult but not that easy either. If you've got common sense and have played these kind of games before it'll be a treat. Excellent story with a nice twist and great voice acting.
Game reminded me of Flashback from Sega Genesis. Great story with good puzzles. It combines a detective genre with a space genre effectively.
one of the best puzzle/adventure games i've ever played.. you really need to pay attention to conversations and details.. interesting story line.. cant wait for the new one..

Point and click game with a sci fi detective mystery meets 1984 plot...graphics are way outdated but doesn't affect the experience..one of the best games you can get on your phone..no iap either..wish the creator made more games like this..

This is the best dramatic detective game I've ever played. Some parts are tricky and can bring you to the edge of frustration, but it's SO worth figuring things out instead of using a cheat sheet. Excellent! And a great length; well worth the money. More! :)

title.label: A truly amazing and well made retro adventure!

content.label:
This game is AMAZING. I love and have been a fan of "point & click" adventure games from way back. But having never played one on the iPad before, I was a little weary. As another reviewer said, I wish I had taken a chance on this game a long time ago. Not only did it live up to expectations, it blew them out of the water. The art, story and gameplay are absolutely top notch.

If you grew up on Sierra games, Gemini Rue is a dream come true. It definitely has a similar vibe and feel but is also a creation all it's own. Can't tell you how much I love, that not only are people still creating these types of games, but that they are still doing it with pixel art! The artwork is beautiful, detailed and does such a fantastic job of setting the scene. And for those of us who grew up on old school adventure games, the visuals here are truly a step back in time.

The true star of this game though, is the story. I don't know how long it's been since I've played a game where the story line blew me away. Just when you think you've seen all there is to see in sci-fi, this game comes along with something new and fresh and thought provoking. There aren't too many games that kept me thinking about the story well after they were completed. But this was one of them.

All-in-all, just an amazingly well made game. And such a fun experience playing it. It took me a little bit to get into it, but once I did, I was hooked. You get sucked into this bleak, dystopian, world quickly. And by the end, you won't want to leave. And now I want more. I'm clamoring for more old school adventure. But I just can't pull the trigger on any of the similar titles in the App Store. I feel like I've already experienced the best and that the others would be a let-down in comparison, haha. I can only hope Wadjet Eye makes more titles like this. I'd kill for a sequel or something new in the same vein.

It was truly a pleasure playing this game. Thank you Wadjet Eye!
Very detailed game.  The voice overs are great.

Game in the App Store to date.
Still haven't found anything that beats it. Some have come close (maybe even tied) but it doesn't get better than this.

I was unsure of buying this game based on the look of it, but after playing and beating it I wish I had bought it sooner. The story is amazing! It's like being part of a great movie. Definitely worth it! Some parts are a little tricky and I had to look them up but still worth 5 stars!
Really enjoy the wadjet-eye click adventures. This is the one that got me hooked. Thanks for a thoughtful game with some depth.
Game is complete garbage , you can't even use a walk through because there isn't a way to open the inventory which you should be able to do . It just makes everything dumb and confusing .

This game is great.  I loved the Silent Age, Bik, and the Broken Sword series.  I only had to look at a walkthrough once and the length of the game was appropriate for price point. Voice acting was good and the plot was awesome.  I'm glad I finally bought it.  Finished it today.
Completely engrossing. I really enjoyed it. Bravo!

I loved this game. The only thing is, at certain points there are things you have to do. There is nothing to help you when you get stuck or confused. I found a youtube video that helped me pass those points. Hope they make another one.
Taking Sierra and Lucasarts style games, the best imo, into the modern era. I love all your works and can't wait for Shard as well as perhaps Technobabylon on iOS?!
Pretty fun. Had a happy week with this.

The thinking's man game. The story is completely engrossing. The narration immerses you and the game itself is non-linear. Do yourself a favor and don't cheat! You'll be sorry when the game is over and then feel bored with every other iOS game u come across. I wish for a Gemini 2 with expanded story, characters and game scope. Simply awesome.
I love the story!!! Totally worth the money
Awesome game. It's so unpredictable and I loved the story. It has an atmosphere that reminds me to Blade Runner. Congratulations and thanks for the game.

title.label: There are better ways to deploy save-breaking features

content.label:
What should have happened:
1)Put out an update that opens original save files and saves in the new format. 
2) release new version a month or so later. 

What actually happens:
1) release new update that doesn't open old save files as a feature. 

Trust destroyed.... :(

I have not played a point-and-click game in many years and this is the first one I've played on the iPad. It was a lot of fun! (I'm in my 60's and even for us old guys it is a blast).

There were a couple of minor glitches, the program crashed a couple of dozen times before I was finished, but each time, I did not lose anything. I simply opened up the app and hit "continue" and I was right where I left off.

The last time I played a point-and-click game on my PC, it was somewhere around $35, but this was huge fun and a vastly less expensive experience.

Excellent value for the money.

title.label: A good way to spend a rainy weekend

content.label: Was hesitant but very glad I got this game.  Story was interesting, play was fun, enjoyed it all.  Much much better than freemium style things.  Was reminded of the movie "the island".
